Description: Bowl of Nile silt pottery with rounded base, flaring sides and rounded lip, coated with red-brown slip and burnished. On the interior walls are faint traces of decoration in white pigment consisting of sets of 4 lines running diagonally from the rim to the tondo. Both the interior and exterior are worn and the rim is chipped in a number of places, the paint has faded leaving only ghost impressions.
Curator's comments: Similar to White Cross lined ware C16b in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
